reviewText: I was in the 1st grade when this show debut on abc & then the show was later on syndication, I miss these days in the 80's & miss watching these classic entertainers on tv, I smile & laugh out loud when I watch this set, wish the rest of the seasons were on DVD, thank you Ted Knight & Company for the memories & laughter

reviewText: Ted Knight plays a very funny dad to two pretty daughters. It's been years since I've watched it but it still holds up well. It's better than many of the sitcoms that air today. I'd recommend it to my friends.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I would have given this DVD set 5 stars if Rhino had simply released it properly (complete episodes as originally aired instead of the syndicated versions).Even though it's edited I'm still very glad that I own this box set. I hadn't seen this series since the late 80's and it's as funny as I remember it! Ted Knight is wonderful and the rest of the cast are PERFECT.Just remember, this series deserves 5 stars... it's just the DVD release that causes the rating to drop.I sincerely hope that Rhino decides to re-release the first season properly. I know that I'd gladly buy it again! I'm also looking forward to the third season and I'm wondering what they plan to do about the "ted knight show" episodes?Come on Rhino... re-release this box set properly and please give us the third season + the ted knight show episodes
summary: A series worthy of 5 stars! A DVD box set worthy of only 3!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well, this is depressing.  I liked this show, but hadn't thought of it in years.  Something reminded me of it recently.  I was momentarily excited to see that at least a couple of seasons were out on DVD, until I read the reviews.  I'll second what others have already said - it makes no sense to release edited episodes on DVD.  It's obvious that fans are not happy with this increasing practice.  The cover clearly says "The Complete First Season."  If the episodes are incomplete edited episodes, then this DVD set does not contain the complete first season.  It's actually the incomplete first season.  Could selling it as "The Complete First Season" be considered false advertising?
Title: N/A

reviewText: First of all: to all of you who written bad critics sayin that Rhino did a poor job, I don't agree. You got to realize that this show is not a huge hit, they knew they wouldn't sell as much as shows like Seinfeld, Sex And The City, Buffy, Cheers, M*A*S*H. So they couldn't invest tons of money in the making of this series to DVD considering the approx. amount of units they would sell.I was really happy with this release, I laughed a lot and even if the picture quality is average, the sound is correct. If you liked this series when you were a kid, or if you would like to discover this serie for the first time, don't hesitate, It'll make you laugh....a lot! Can't wait for season 2......if they ever release it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Iloved this set and had no complaints at all, I emailed Rhino, just days ago to find out when season two was coming, they emailed me back and told me, season two was coming 5/24/05, I hope this helps Too close for comfort fans, I  Loved Ted Knight and thought this took him light years away from his Ted Baxter character, which , I think the public was ready for and so was he.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here we go again, another TV series with EDITED versions on DVD. Why should we pay good money for cut shows? The uncut versions are readily available, but someone probably didn't want to spend a few extra dollars to remaster them, so instead they dump the syndication prints on the market and hope the consumer is too dumb to notice.If you buy this set, saying it isn't a big deal...let me ask you a question.  Would you be upset if you bought a book from Amazon and then found out that 10 to 15 % of the pages had been removed? OF COURSE YOU WOULD! This is no different.Boycott this and the many other edited TV shows on DVD (the list is growing, sadly) and send polite letters to Rhino Home Video telling them why they aren't getting your money.AVOID THIS SET!
Title: N/A

reviewText: It will interest all concerned to know that at a specific website is an alterations list.  I read about the fact that the First Season of Too Close for Comfort consisted of syndicated episodes, for which reason, I will neither purchase nor rent it.  The studios who release DVDs of television program have COLOSSAL NERVE calling a set 'complete' when it is not really that complete AT ALL.  The list of alterations is growing and leads me to question if releasing television programs on DVD is such a good idea anymore.THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF WORK THAT HAS TO BE DONE.
summary: Hey, Hey, Ho, Ho, edited DVDs have to go
Title: N/A

reviewText: This show is typical of the era it was produced and originally show in -- late 70s early 80s. You had nothing but feminist moralizing in the dialogue and plot. And you had the rah rah minorities dialog in the plot too. It is enough to make you want to hurl. "My little open minded liberal" . . . eeewwww. Seriously that was a line in the plot. "I feel so sorry for the minorities  . .  . how do they get  job in this economy?" Another stupid comment. They even short change the "conservative viewpoint" that they have. They try (not very hard) to have Ted Knight's character be the typical old, "old fashioned", outdated, dummy with the "conservative opinion" only for him to "come around" by the end of the show. But even he would have a 15 second monologue on how oppressed women were in the workplace here and there. Then you had the non-stop sometimes creepy sexual innuendo . . . . The mom is supposed to represent typical mom when it comes to sex and such talk. But what comes out of this character's mouth is shocking and kinda creepy. She has these looks too like she is staring off in space. It is weird. You have the "dumb blond" with sweaters so tight and jeans so tight and shorts so short and tight you don't have to guess anything about her anatomy. Even the male characters wear the typical tight jeans that guys back in that era wore--too tight. You had the gay guy playing a "straight" guy as a gay guy. If I am not mistaken that guy contracted AIDS while this show was in production and his "lover" died from AIDS. You have season one centering around a man who dressed up as a woman and they keep mentioning it and bringing it back into the shows for that season. It isn't to make fun of him. It is done in a so what that is how he is way. There are two spoiled daughters that whine all the time about "Im an adult let me be one and " 1) use the pill if i want to 2) work in a strip club if I want to 3) etc etc etc. It was just a joke. Bad acting. Bad morality. Bad politics. Bad society. Bad culture. Bad plots. Bad concept. Bad show. Skip this and let it stay back in the era of excess and debauchery.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When I saw this show was in DVD I thought "Great that was a funny show".  So when I dug up enough cash I bought it.  So I started watching this and have made it through the first have of the first season and am now deciding whether or not I want to watch the rest of the collection or just pawn it off as a used dvd.  Still deciding, but this one don't have much more time in my house.  Look this show aint on Tv Land for a reason - it's aged and lost it's funniness.As for the show being edited.  Look all movies are edited also.  No big deal and I am sure what you are missing are the moments that weren't worth airing anyways.  I found the missing two minutes on each episode no big loss.
summary: Not as Funny as I remembered
